doc.field: Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 18
Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 18
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
1. Lesbian and Gay News: Andy Humm and Ann Northrop discuss recent general events that relate to the LGBT community.
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, Earth Share, "It's a connected world."
COMMERCIAL: Ad Council, National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression

2. Footage of Marsha Scott, [of the Clinton Administration], and Bob Hattoy, gay activist, speaking at the Lesbian and Gay Community Services Center regarding President Bill Clinton's candidacy for re-election.
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
4. Footage of Gay and Lesbian Business Expo. Includes interview with Candace Gingrich, of the Human Rights Campaign.
COMMERCIAL: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), "America Responds to AIDS"
COMMERCIAL: Dan Gendron, Horologist, "Stop paying too much for antique watches"
6. Andy Humm discusses the musical Rent. Includes muted performance footage.
7. Lou Maletta interviews Marion Winik, author, regarding her book "First Comes Love".
COMMERCIAL: Homo Xtra, "The one. The only. The original."
8. Footage of "Cowboys, La Cage, & More" at the Blue Angel.

9. Footage of Mr. Leather New York contest '96. Includes footage of Andy Borden, Mr. Leather NY '95; [Paul Zinser], Second Runner Up; Frank Quesada, First Runer Up; and Joe Gallagher, [winner of] Mr. Leather NY 1996.
Gay USA, Vol. XIV, Episode No. 18: 1996
